David Sondak

I am a Lecturer in the Institute for Applied Computational Science (IACS) at Harvard University where I conduct research and teach classes.

My research is at the intersection of applied mathematics, physics, and machine learning with an emphasis on fluid mechanics and multiscale phenomena.

At IACS, I teach classes on basic software principles (CS207) and extreme computing (AC290r). I have also led a version of the capstone course (AC297r) which requires students to work closely with industrial and academic partners to solve real-world problems.

  • email: dsondak@seas.harvard.edu
  • github: github.com/dsondak
